resources.description:
The original record level data (as a Zipped CSV file)

Columns headers:
* Age Range
* Court
* Offence Type
* Sentence Outcome
* Amount (fine)
* Force (i.e. related police force)
* Sex/Gender
* Ethnicity
* Offence to Completion


More details about the dataset available here:
http://www.justice.gov.uk/statistics/criminal-justice/criminal-justice-statistics

This is Ministry of Justice data
resources.name: Record Level Data - Criminal Justice Data in CSV

resources.description:
This data is identical to the CSV, except that it has been converted into a Linked Open Data structure (RDF/Turtle) by Daniel Lewis on behalf of the Open Knowledge Foundation (OKFN) as part of the LOD2 EU Project.

It utilises its own in-built schema, and reaches out to the statistics vocabulary on publishmydata (for age ranges) and SDMX for sex/gender codes.

There are over 12 million triples, and the file expands to around 640MB.

The base Graph URI should be:
http://www.justice.gov.uk/statistics/criminal-justice/criminal-justice-statistics

The base URI of the schema should be:
http://www.justice.gov.uk/statistics/criminal-justice/criminal-justice-statistics/dsd#

The base URI of the dataset should be:
http://www.justice.gov.uk/statistics/criminal-justice/criminal-justice-statistics/data#
resources.name: Record Level Data - Criminal Justice in RDF-Turtle

organization.description: A group for anyone interested in open data related to Civil Society (voluntary, civic and social organisations). Things to do: 1. Join the Civil Society Open Data Interest Group 2. Subscribe to the Civil Society Open Data Email List 3. Add datasets to the Civil Society Open Datastore (here) What is Civil Society? "Civil Society is composed of the totality of voluntary civic and social organizations and institutions that form the basis of a functioning society, as distinct from the force-backed structures of a state (regardless of that state's political system) and commercial institutions of the market." Wikipedia
organization.title: Civil Society
organization.name: civil-society

name: uk-criminal-justice
notes: This dataset presents the key trends on the latest twelve months of activity in the Criminal Justice System (CJS) for England and Wales.
title: UK Criminal Justice data
